sentences.english: Now the situation has lost its survival soil.
sentences.chinese: 过去那种“暴利”没商量的行情已失去了生存土壤。

sentences.english: By some estimates, it generates billions of dollars each year.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，这类活动牟取的暴利每年可达几十亿美元。

sentences.english: In the past the kind of " profiteering" Now the situation has lost its survival soil.
sentences.chinese: 过去那种“暴利”没商量的行情已失去了生存土壤。

sentences.english: But it still affected building materials market profiteering.
sentences.chinese: 但这依然影响了建材市场的暴利。

sentences.english: Rent controls were introduced to prevent profiteering.
sentences.chinese: 为了防止牟取暴利而实行了租金管制。

sentences.english: The bottling is actually kind of interesting …
sentences.chinese: 其实装瓶业还是挺暴利的一个行业。

sentences.english: The people will stop your profiteering schemes, and the people will win .
sentences.chinese: 人民将阻止你们牟取暴利的诡计，人民必胜。

sentences.english: First, how to curb profiteering in real estate business.
sentences.chinese: 第一，如何制止牟取暴利的房地产业务。

sentences.english: This year, trading has generated windfalls.
sentences.chinese: 今年，交易则带来了暴利。

sentences.english: They adulterated the high-quality gold ornaments to reap fabulous profits.
sentences.chinese: 高档黄金饰品中掺假以牟取暴利。

sentences.english: The central bank canceled the pre-sale housing proposals can end property profiteering ?
sentences.chinese: 央行取消房屋预售建议能否终结房产暴利？

sentences.english: These camps and roadblocks are the checkpoints of violence.
sentences.chinese: 这些营寨和障碍是暴利检查站。

sentences.english: Rent controls were introduced to prevent profiteering.
sentences.chinese: 为了防止牟取暴利因此实行了租金控制。

sentences.english: Now the windfall tax threshold is 40 US dollars each barrel.
sentences.chinese: 现时暴利税起征点为每桶40美元。

sentences.english: They become “profiteers” in the eyes of those hurt by rising prices.
sentences.chinese: 在涨价受害者眼里，商人变成了牟取暴利的奸商。

sentences.english: The houses have become a few rich people's means of cornering and profiteering.
sentences.chinese: 住宅成了少数一些富人囤积居奇谋取暴利的手段。

definition: small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
to buy and sell at a profit/to speculate
to make a profit/to earn a packet
to resell at a profit/to speculate
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/exploitation
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/see also 謀取|谋取[mou2 qu3]
speculation and profiteering (idiom); buying and selling on speculation
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
